subject: Mental Health
title: Gaming Disorder
description: A fast breakdown of Gaming Disorder for builders.

hook.text: A teenager plays video games 16 hours a day and fails out of school. Is it addiction?

buildup.text: The WHO recognized gaming disorder in 2018 when patterns mimicked substance addiction.

discovery.text: Games use loot boxes, leveling, and social pressure to activate reward circuits.

twist.text: Not all heavy gaming is addiction â€” impairment and loss of control are the key criteria.

climax.text: South Korea and China have implemented gaming curfews for minors.

punchline.text: When play becomes compulsion, the game plays you.

quiz.question: When did the WHO recognize gaming disorder?
